function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Crowding in nursing homes associated with a higher incidence of covid-19 infection and mortality.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Significant research gaps in understanding the association of built environment be attributes with the spread of covid-19.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate resources for cities to manage health challenges arising from climate change.","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exposure to mosquitoes due to housing quality and urban planning","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited access to permanent running water and urban heat stress","category":"Water Cycle","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mosquitoes not flying over high walls or far distances limits the effectiveness of insecticide dissemination","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate water access leading to water storage practices that enable mosquito proliferation and disease transmission","category":"Water Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Solid waste providing breeding sites for mosquitoes","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to find and treat the abundance of potential breeding sites for immature mosquito stages.","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unclear efficacy of personal protective methods against daytime biting mosquitoes.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient methods for targeting new invasive mosquito species and promoting green spaces in urban settings.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on adult female mosquitoes to disseminate insecticide-auto-dissemination for targeting ae. aegypti.","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased dengue risk associated with inner city parks and green spaces","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Temperature-dependency of mosquito vectorial capacity for arboviruses and malaria parasites","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex urban environment and man-made containers as oviposition sites for mosquitoes","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in mosquito-borne diseases due to excess vegetation and green zones","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Thermal discomfort in tropical countries due to excessive vegetal mass","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Varied effectiveness of greening strategies in different climatic conditions","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of malaria vector to new geographical areas","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of knowledge of key epidemiological drivers for urban vector-borne diseases","category":"Water Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increasing urbanization and growth of urban mosquito vector species","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Heat island effect in urban areas","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of invasive mosquito vectors","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of novel arboviruses into new areas","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Urban malaria transmission and adaptation of mosquito vectors","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of invasive mosquito species competent for arbovirus transmission, including zika and chikungunya","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Territorial expansion of aedes spp. incriminated as vectors for arboviruses and parasitic nematodes","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased local temperatures due to urbanization leading to higher incidence of mosquito-borne diseases such as dengue, zika, and yellow fever","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Climate-associated changes in precipitation disproportionately affecting urban and rural environments in terms of mosquito oviposition sites","category":"Water Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Challenges in estimating urban mosquito species distributions and abundance, leading to poor estimation of urban disease exposure","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global warming leading to an increased burden of mosquito-borne diseases","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in heat-related deaths due to hotter days and more frequent heatwaves","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease and cardio-vascular disease due to particulate matter and wildfires","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Worsening of air quality and increase in airborne allergens leading to allergic diseases like asthma and rhino-conjunctivitis","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased urbanization leading to limited understanding of urban health and disparities","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Creation of urban heat islands uhis due to greenhouse gas production and urbanization","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Local-scale variation in uhi intensity due to urban geometry","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Urbanization leading to higher environmental challenges for human health","category":"City/Metropolis","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increase in global average temperature","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pressure differentials not maintained in aiirs","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unintended door opening in temporary aiirs","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate negative pressure in patient rooms and anterooms","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate maintenance and monitoring of negative air machines","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of infectious particles from isolation rooms into the corridor due to lack of anterooms","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective design and construction of anterooms leading to difficulty in using ppe and disinfecting medical devices","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate size of anterooms leading to insufficient space for health care workers to operate","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate number of aiirs airborne infection isolation rooms for severely affected covid-19 patients","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate room size and equipment for critical covid-19 patients requiring extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, mechanical ventilation, or continuous renal replacement therapy","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortage of airborne-infection isolation rooms aiirs for covid-19 patients","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to consider airflow in the built environment","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"}]}
